result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelviceo D Freeman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Waived all non-mandatory, costs, fees and surcharges, balance to be paid during probation, if revoked to come from 25% of prison funds, unpaid balance paid results in a civil judgment.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
No contact with J.K.P. and Tangina G.

Batterers intervention program.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Comply with terms of Juvenile Probation.
Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
Defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is/is not needed.

Defendant Kelviceo D Freeman in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance, defendant advised he must comply with orders of the court and attend Cog. classes. Case adjourned for additional review.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Per e-mail from DOC Agent, court granted agent's request for an adjourned probation review hearing. Case adjourned to branch 23 for 12/19/2014 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Kelviceo D Freeman in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS & 6 MONTHS,  credit for 76 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR & 6 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 100 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with J.K.P. and Tangina G.
-Comply with terms of Juvenile Probation.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Waived all  non-mandatory, costs, fees, and surcharges, balance to be paid during probation, if revoked to come from 25% of prison funds,unpaid balance paid results in a civil judgment.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. 
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

AS TO COUNT 1 & 2 Per Amended Information:
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record

Defendant Kelviceo D Freeman in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Defendant Kelviceo D Freeman in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. 
Received & Filed, Amended Information.
COUNT 1: Physical Abuse of A Child, contrary to Wis. Stat. 948.03(3)(b), a class I Felony.
COUNT 2: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 968.075(1)(a), a class B Misdemeanor.
AS TO AMEND INFORMATION
Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Attorney Cheryl A Ward in court, defendant Kelviceo D Freeman not in court, in custody.  Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cheryl A Ward in court, defendant Kelviceo D Freeman not in court, in custody.  Matthew Puthukulam on behalf of Cynthis Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.  
FILE NOT IN COURT. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for adjourned scheduling date to review discovery with client. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for scheduling conference to branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kelviceo D Freeman in court with attorney Cheryl A Ward.  Defendant Kelviceo D Freeman in custody.  Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Amy Stolowski-MPD Detective.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Branch 23 is unable to hear this matter. Branch PE agreed to hear this matter for Branch 23. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tangina G or JKP dob 6/28/11

Defendant Kelviceo D Freeman in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Kelviceo D Freeman in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
